text_section1.text: What were they? Where did they come from? What were they doing on Earth?

text_section2.text: The Fireballs!

text_section1.text: It was young Ed Snowden and Leroy Bean who saw it first --

text_section2.text: It sure is a dark night, Ed!

text_section3.text: You sure picked a bad time to take a short cut through these woods!

text_section1.text: It's the best way I know to get home fast!

text_section2.text: Ed! It's getting light!

text_section1.text: But there's no moon! I --

text_section2.text: Look, Ed... up there!

text_section1.text: W-what are they?

text_section2.text: Nothing that I ever heard about! Ed -- let's get out of here!

text_section1.text: What the two boys saw were round, bright lights moving through the forest like strange, flying creatures. Suddenly, as the boys broke from cover, the lights swiftly bore down on them --- !

text_section2.text: Run, Ed! They're fire -- great balls of fire!

text_section1.text: An hour later, the boys stumbled, wet and weary, into the farm house belonging to Ed Snowden's family ---

text_section2.text: Ed! Leroy! You're drenched to the skin! What happened?

text_section3.text: The fireballs -- ! They almost got us!

text_section1.text: We had to jump into Brown's lake and swim for it!

text_section2.text: What's this nonsense about fireballs? Are you boys covering up some mischief?

text_section1.text: This was cleared up an instant later. The night outside the Snowden house turned into day ---

text_section2.text: Land o' Goshen!

text_section1.text: The boys were right -- fireballs!!
Word spread swiftly ---

text_section2.text: I think I counted eight of 'em, Sheriff -- get down here right away!

text_section1.text: Having read about the fanciful sighting of flying saucer fans, the Sheriff was reluctant to appear. However, when he did come, he was given a most unworldly reception --

text_section2.text: Great day in the mornin'-- it's true!

text_section1.text: They're coming after me -- I've got to get help!
Bullets can't hurt 'em -- wonder what they are?
After a series of telephone calls, a group of scientists from the state college were flown to the scene --

text_section2.text: It's a most extraordinary situation -- it can't be what they imply!

text_section1.text: Probably some sort of natural phenomenon, I suppose --

text_section2.text: Is that what you mean, professor?

text_section1.text: My word! It - it's fantastic! Those lights are moving with a purpose!

text_section2.text: Yeah -- one of them is looking into the window, like it's trying to decide what we are!

text_section1.text: The scientific group was quite shaken when they landed. The fireballs had followed them down and milled about the area ---

text_section2.text: We've got to start making notes -- find out all we can about them!

text_section3.text: I wonder if they are dangerous?

text_section1.text: Later, equipment is flown in, and an attempt at analyzing the fireballs is made --

text_section2.text: They're energy -- pure energy! And they emit waves mighty similar to human brain waves!

text_section1.text: Suddenly, without warning, one of the firey spheres swoops down and engulfs one of the men!
Although the man glows with the strange radiance, he seems unharmed by it. Then, he speaks ---

text_section2.text: With the universal sign of peace we greet you!

text_section3.text: The fireball is using him to communicate with us!

text_section1.text: We are inhabitants of the star you know as your sun! We have observed signs of our own species on your planet!
B-but that's impossible! There is no species on the planet composed of living, intelligent energy!

text_section2.text: All life of Earth consists of matter!

text_section1.text: That is not true -- we have seen our species here!
Of course! They've seen out atomic explosions -- our bikini tests!

text_section2.text: That's it! We've released your kind of energy -- but it's not alive! It's just a series of experiments -- !

text_section1.text: At that moment, a group of large, circular lights appeared in the night sky ---

text_section2.text: Look! More of them! More fireballs!

text_section3.text: No, they're not! We call them by a different name!

text_section1.text: The sudden appearance of the disc lights causes the fireballs to release the man and shoot skyward ---
The men below watched as one of the circular lights broke out of formation to meet the rising fireballs...
Why, it's fantastic the way those lights are acting! One would think they're --

text_section2.text: -- talking to each other!

text_section1.text: Suddenly, the fireballs join the ranks of the discs and the entire group flash into the darkness and disappear!

text_section2.text: They're taking off!

text_section1.text: Yes, the fireballs were right! There is an intelligent energy life, native to our planet! But it live in out skies!

text_section2.text: Strange -- we never thought of them as living creatures!

text_section1.text: We've called them UFO's... spaceships... flying saucers!

text_section2.text: The end.
